As Founder, my primary role is helping our clients differentiate themselves through talent and culture. For most organizations, the single biggest opportunity is in the untapped potential, passion, and purpose of its people.When people align their own sense of purpose to the organization's mission, engagement issues disappear and culture becomes a true differentiator for the customer experience.About PhosLabsPhos is the greek word for light. We strive to capture and develop phos moments, when you make meaning of new knowledge, discard old habits that no longer serve you, and then visibly demonstrate new behaviors and learning.PhosLabs helps organizations elevate their customer experiences by closing gaps between ideas, execution, and culture. We deliver this through coaching and collaboration programs that improve leadership, engagement, and alignment at all levels. For todayâ€™s turbulent and rapid-response business environment, PhosLabs develops resilient leadership and learning networks. As a result, we enable teams and individuals to adapt to ever-changing customer demands with greater success.The firm's unique approach provides immediate impact from day one while also ensuring lasting positive change. Organizations rely on PhosLabs to ready them for the future of work by nurturing greater trust, transparency, and teamwork.

The unifying theme across my body of work is leading transformative changes for both organizations and individuals. Whether wearing the hat of instigator, navigator, facilitator, or coach, my primary mission is to create an environment where others can more easily do their best work.Examples:* Aligning employee engagement with organizational strategy.* Facilitating board retreats and workshops.* Delivering specific solutions like Innovation Councils or SlowNetworking.* Interim executive roles, especially during turnarounds/transformations.

Co-founder of PL Coaches, LLC. Our mission is to increase the levels of Project Success for our clients by building up their project leadership capability. We do this through an innovative hybrid approach that combines consulting, training, and coaching.Co-authored and co-designed innovative Project Leadership development program based on peer-to-peer learning, group coaching, and action learrning.

Southwest Job Network (SJN) is a tax-exempt 501(c)(3) non-profit that helps experienced professionals in the Phoenix Metro Valley who are in career transition. recommendations: September 13, 2014, David was a client of Raoulâ€™s

Raoul is first and foremost a great person who goes out of his way to help others simply because he likes doing it. His experience and skills are a tremendous asset. I met Raoul through the Project Leadership training that PL Coaches provided for volunteers at PMI, Phoenix Chapter. From the very first session (even just the program overview) I realized Raoul was offering what is a major part of Project Management that wasn't covered in the exam prep training I received. I had training on the mechanics of PM but when it came to team building and people skills, PL Coaches had hit upon what I felt was extremely key to being a truly great project manager. First the term Credibility came up, followed by Relationships, Trust, Influence, and Accountability. I realized immediately that proficiency in these areas would make a huge difference in the overall success of the project as well as becoming the PM that team members and Stakeholders want to run their next project. In addition, Raoul provided individual coaching to his students that were in career transition on a pro bono basis. He turned my strategy completely around and now I am seeing tremendous benefits by following his suggestions. I highly recommend Raoul and his team for any individual or company that wants to take Project Management to the next level. The techniques they teach will contribute greatly to project success for all who adapt the principles they present.

September 8, 2014, Laurie was a client of Raoulâ€™s

Raoul via PL Coaches took a group of 6 Avnet Project Managers through a 14 week journey of self discovery.  I am pleased to say that I am one of the 6 that took that journey with Raoul.  Raoul provided a structure approach for us to become project leaders.  He provided reading material, a format for self-reflection, helpful tools, anecdotes and coaching to support us as we grew in each of the project leadership dimensions.   Raoul was a perfect fit for us.  Not only is he an experienced PM but he has relevant experiences that he balanced with coaching ad directing to grow us in the areas where we felt the weakest. We have kept his coaching fresh by continuing to meet monthly (and ad hoc) to support one another as we strive to become better project leaders.  Thanks, Raoul!

So it is no surprise to me Raoul has advanced his career into leadership and supporting others. As a 'hiring manager and internal client' at Entex, Raoul would challenge me with the impossible (let's hire 60 technical experts for a great client this weekend!!) and then support and partner with me though meeting those goals (I think we hired 61 by Sunday night)! He takes the time to relate to others, understand them and understand how to help them meet their career goals. He is a wonderful leader, mentor and coach!

I contacted Raoul after he requested input on ways to update the Get Wired 2 Get Hired presentation from the SJN curriculum. Raoul responded right away and we met soon after. He was receptive to including library research guidelines and provided me with more information on the curriculum to help me organize the data. I find Raoul to be responsive, helpful and extremely knowledgeable about job search effectiveness. I would work with Raoul again and recommend him to any member needing help with job search, using linkedin and networking. He is an exellent presenter as well and stays on topic!

May 19, 2016, Raoul was a client of Angelaâ€™s

I strongly recommend Angela as a professional coach to anyone, and especially to other coaches, leadership development professionals, and anyone else who wants to walk their talk. It takes a special talent to be be an expert resource to someone else in your field or occupation, and Angela is special. I engaged Angela to help me navigate a difficult professional transition. She was absolutely outstanding in this capacity. Angela helped me get clarity on obstacles that were weighing me down, and also balanced my needs between support and accountability that enabled me to move forward.Moreover, Angela was referred to me through a trusted connection at the Hudson Institute who knew I had additional requirements, such as remote coaching via phone and scheduling flexibility. In this and other regards, Angela was very adaptive to my needs.

Paige is the go-to leader you want in todayâ€™s fast-paced, frenetic, and fun entrepreneurial world. As the co-organizer for PHX Startup Week, she delivered a professionally-run event that handled a 100% attendance jump year-over-year, and she did it working through an extended team of volunteer staff. Through her leadership, attention to detail, and creative problem solving, she was able to coordinate 160+ sessions over 10 venues in 5 days with >4000 registered attendees. Despite the typical tactical chaos of an event of this size, she did it with a smile, a resilient attitude, and an unmatched level of energy and enthusiasm. Most impressively, and what most people didnâ€™t see, is her strategic planning and thoughtfulness ahead of time. Because of her investment in building strong and trusted working relationships, she was the embodiment of bringing a community together around a common cause. When I have a critical, high-visibility event that I need delivered professionally, the first person Iâ€™ll call is Paige Soucie.

summary: Serving clients, communities, and companies who crave fresh thinking, new ways of working, and better results through their people. After a career of solving business problems through technology and process improvements, am now focused on helping people in teams, groups, and organizations do the best work of their lives.Examples:* Development of Leaders at all Levels, through group coaching and peer-to-peer learning* 1-on-1 coaching for speakers, executives, entrepreneurs,  and community leaders* Facilitation and workshops for strategy, culture, creativity, innovation, disruption, and more.BIO:Raoulâ€™s expertise is leading transformative changes for organizations and individuals. With 20 years of documented achievements, he has led measurable performance improvements, organizational changes, and large-scale, complex multi-million dollar projects for organizations such as the US Government, Hoffman La-Roche, Microsoft, Charles Schwab, Whirlpool, and dozens of small and mid-size businesses.As a past member of the Southwest Job Network Board and City of Phoenix Business & Workforce Development Board, Raoulâ€™s volunteer passion is to close the gap between businesses needs and the workforce. In this capacity, he has trained and coached hundreds of individuals nationwide. Raoul holds a BS in Business Management â€“ Information Technology from Western Governors University and is developing stronger coaching capabilities through an intensive development program of the Hudson Institute of Coaching.JOB SEEKERS: I will work with you, no charge, to improve your job search effectiveness.
name: Raoul Encinas
title: Coaching, Facilitation, and Experiential Learning for leaders at all levels, engaged employees, and culture
